title: Steady pound, growth worries pressure FTSE 100; Galliford jumps

Steady pound, growth worries pressure FTSE 100; Galliford jumps

Stock Markets 3 minutes ago (Sep 10, 2019 08:41)

(Reuters) - UK blue-chip shares slipped on Tuesday, as a second set of disappointing data from China this week cemented fears of a slowdown in global economic growth, while gains in the pound amid fading no-deal Brexit worries hit multinational stocks. The FTSE 100 index ( ) dipped 0.4%, having suffered its worst day this month in the last session, with equipment rental giant Ashtead (L: ) falling 3% after in-line results. The more domestically-focussed index of midcaps ( ) was flat by 0705 GMT, supported by a 22% jump in Galliford Try (L: ) after the construction company said it had restarted preliminary talks to sell its residential units to housebuilder Bovis Homes (L: ). Sterling was seen close to a six-week high it hit on Monday after parliament passed a bill blocking a no-deal Brexit, weighing on British American Tobacco (L: ) and Diageo (L: ) as strength in the local currency meant the value of their U.S. earnings would be lower.
